info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 10 at 4:48PM MDT until May 10 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT FOR NORTHEASTERN YUMA COUNTY... At 447 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Wray, moving north at 30 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR Wray and areas north. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported baseball sized hail in Wray, Colorado. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Yuma County, including the following locations... Laird, Beecher Island, Alvin, Vernon and Wauneta. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 224 and 263. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern Colorado...northwestern Kansas...and southwestern Nebraska. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
